block.p: Yvette Lynn Perry and Michael L. Campbell were married yesterday in the Virgin Islands. The Rev. Emmanuel Jaggernauth performed the nondenominational ceremony at the Caneel Bay Resort in Caneel Bay, on St. John.

Mrs. Campbell, 34, is a dancer with the Monte/- Brown Dance Company, a modern dance troupe in New York. The bride is also a freelance graphic designer and computer programmer in New York. She graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and studied at the Alvin Ailey American Dance Center.

Yvette Lynn Perry and Michael L. Campbell were married yesterday in the Virgin Islands. The Rev. Emmanuel Jaggernauth performed the nondenominational ceremony at the Caneel Bay Resort in Caneel Bay, on St. John.

Mrs. Campbell, 34, is a dancer with the Monte/- Brown Dance Company, a modern dance troupe in New York. The bride is also a freelance graphic designer and computer programmer in New York. She graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and studied at the Alvin Ailey American Dance Center.

She is the daughter of Linda E. Prudhomme of Alta Loma, Calif., and Jemajo J. Perry of Los Angeles, and the stepdaughter of James A. Prudhomme Jr. Her mother is a lawyer practicing in Alta Loma. Her father retired as a custodian at Los Angeles Community College. The bride's stepfather is a deputy district attorney in Los Angeles County. The bride is the granddaughter of the late Lincoln Perry, who was the actor known as Stepin Fetchit.

Mr. Campbell, 33, is a vice president in the merchant banking group of J. P. Morgan & Company. He graduated from Princeton and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. He is the son of Jennie Smith Campbell of Maplewood, N.J., and Clarence L. Campbell of Baltimore. His mother is the chief executive of the Bergen County Urban League, the nonprofit community services organization, in Englewood, N.J. His father manages his own investments in companies engaged in business development in sub-Saharan Africa.
